sen.e: The next day of the proclamation of the Constitution, he gave a speech at Rokumeikan on the doctrine of superiority which insists 'the government should keep its originality without restrictions of the Diet and the political party'.

The next day of the proclamation of the Constitution, he gave a speech at Rokumeikan on the doctrine of superiority which insists 'the government should keep its originality without restrictions of the Diet and the political party'.

The next day of the proclamation of the constitution, he delivered a speech in Rokumeikan, insisting, 'the government should pursue its own way free from any restraints from the Diet and political parties,' which represented his principle called Chozen Shugi.

sen.j: 黒田内閣は、大隈重信が主導した不平等条約改正交渉の失敗によって大隈が襲撃され、翌明治22年 （1889年）10月に倒れた。
sen.e: Shigenobu OKUMA was attacked due to the failure of the negotiation for the revision of the Unequal Treaty led by OKUMA, then the next year, in October 1889, KURODA cabinet fell.
Shigenobu OKUMA was attacked due to the failure of the negotiation for the revision of the Unequal Treaty led by OKUMA, then the next year, in October 1889, KURODA cabinet fell.
The Kuroda Cabinet collapsed in October 1889, after the negotiations to revise unequal treaty initiated by Shigenobu OKUMA resulted in failure and Okuma was assaulted.

sen.j: 改正の条件に外国人の裁判官をおくという別の不平等をもってきたことが、国内の反対を受けたのである（辞職後2ヶ月間三条実美内大臣が首相を兼任）。
sen.e: Another unequal term for the revision which was to place a foreign judge met with the opposition internally. (For 2 months after resignation Minister of the Interior, Sanetomi SANJO held the post of Prime Minister concurrently).

Another unequal term for the revision which was to place a foreign judge met with the opposition internally. (For 2 months after resignation Minister of the Interior, Sanetomi SANJO held the post of Prime Minister concurrently).

During the negotiations, he accepted the appointment of foreign judges in Japan as a condition for revising the treaty, but it meant accepting another unequal article and was opposed by the Japanese public (after Kuroda resigned, Naidaijin [Minister of the Center] Sanetomi SANJO concurrently served as Prime Minister for two months).

sen.j: なお、この時に、条約改正案に反対した井上馨への鬱積から、酒に酔ったまま井上邸内に忍び込むという事件（1889年12月15日夜）を起こして政府内から非難を浴びて謹慎している。
sen.e: Having his pent-up discontent to Kaoru INOUE who opposed to the proposal of treaty revision, drunk KURODA caused an incident by sneaking into the residence of INOUE (at night on December 15, 1889), so he was blamed and could not leave his house.

Having his pent-up discontent to Kaoru INOUE who opposed to the proposal of treaty revision, drunk KURODA caused an incident by sneaking into the residence of INOUE (at night on December 15, 1889), so he was blamed and could not leave his house.

Meanwhile, Kuroda was upset with Kaoru INOUE, who had opposed the draft revised treaty, and sneaked into Inoue's residence while getting drunk (in the night of December 15, 1889); Kuroda was suspended after being criticized by the government members.

sen.j: 首相辞任後、黒田は枢密顧問官になった。
sen.e: After resignation of Prime Minister, KURODA became a Privy councilor.
After his resignation of Prime Minister, Kuroda became a Privy Councilor.
After his resignation of Prime Minister, Kuroda became a Privy Councilor.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）8月8日、第2次伊藤内閣の逓信省になった。
sen.e: In August 8, 1892, he was assumed Ministry of Communication of the second ITO Cabinet.
sen.cmt: 前半の内容から逓信省ではなく、逓信大臣ではないかと思います。訳文は逓信省になっております。
sen.e: In August 8, 1892, he was appointed Ministry of Communication of the second ITO Cabinet.
In August 8, 1892, he was appointed Ministry of Communication of the second ITO Cabinet.

sen.j: 伊藤内閣のもとで日清戦争が起こったが、特に活躍することなく、明治28年（1895年）に枢密院議長となった。
sen.e: Sino-Japanese war broke out under ITO Cabinet, KURODA did not play the important role particularly, then he became a Chairman of the Privy Council in 1895.
The Sino-Japanese war broke out under the Ito Cabinet, but Kuroda did not play a particularly important role, and he became a Chairman of the Privy Council in 1895.
The Sino-Japanese war broke out under the Ito Cabinet, but Kuroda did not play a particularly important role, and he became a Chairman of the Privy Council in 1895.

sen.j: 明治26年（1893年）から体の不調が募り、仕事に支障をきたすことが多くなった。
sen.e: His bad health condition prevented from working quite often since 1893.
His bad health condition prevented from working quite often since 1893.
He fell sick from 1893 and his work was often interfered with.

sen.j: 明治33年（1900年）8月23日、脳出血で死去した。
sen.e: He died for brain hemorrhage in August 23, 1900.
He died of a brain hemorrhage on August 23, 1900.
He died of a brain hemorrhage on August 23, 1900.

sen.j: 葬儀委員長は榎本武揚であった。
sen.e: The chairman of the funeral ceremony was Takeaki ENOMOTO.
The chairman of the funeral ceremony was Takeaki ENOMOTO.
The chairman of the funeral ceremony was Takeaki ENOMOTO.

sen.j: 薩摩閥の重鎮とはいえ、醜聞と疑獄事件で晩年は浮いた存在となり、同郷の人々は離れていった。
sen.e: Although he was a grand person of Satsuma clique, because of the scandals and a major bribery case, he was no longer respected and the people from the same village parted from him.
Although he was a grand person of Satsuma clique, because of the scandals and a major bribery case, he was no longer respected and the people from the same village parted from him.
Although he was the central figure in the Satsuma domain clique, the scandal and bribery case isolated him in his later years and the people from the same domain left him.

sen.j: 代わって旧幕臣との付き合いが濃密となり、特に外交分野などでは榎本武揚を重用するようになった。
sen.e: Instead of them he communicated with the former retainer of shogun frequently, he began to give an important position to Takeaki ENOMOTO in foreign diplomacy.
Instead of them he communicated with the former retainer of shogun frequently, he began to give an important position to Takeaki ENOMOTO in foreign diplomacy.
Instead, he established close relationships with the former bakufu retainers, especially with Takeaki ENOMOTO whom he highly valued in the areas such as diplomacy.

sen.j: 黒田の死に際し榎本が葬儀委員長を務めたのも、薩摩の人々が黒田を敬遠したためと見られる。
sen.e: The reason why ENOMOTO played the role of a chairman of funeral ceremony was that people in Satsuma avoided KURODA.
It is thought that Enomoto played the role of chairman at the funeral ceremony because people in Satsuma avoided Kuroda.
